Address.Address1: 3799 LAS VEGAS BLVD SOUTH LAS VEGAS

Description.Text: The MGM Grand is home of 5,034 diverse guestrooms, suites and villas with views of the surrounding mountains and the Las Vegas skyline. The art deco-designed guestrooms incorporate plush fabrics, polished woods and glamorously appointed accouterments. Sepia-toned photographs on textured canvas showcase MGM Studios' stars in casual settings and are positioned within the main corridor of each guest floor. The carpet, lighting and wall coverings in each of the four wings of the Grand Tower are coordinated in a distinct color exclusive to that corridor for ease of guests locating their room or suite. In addition to the deluxe rooms and a variety of suite offerings, the 29th floor offers three Grand Class suites and four villas. This mega-resort offers the maximum Vegas experience, with its award-winning restaurants, 170,000 square feet of gaming area, five outdoor pools, including a gently flowing river, private cabanas, cocktail service and a seasonal restaurant. The 30,000 sq ft Grand Spa and Salon features a fitness center and full-service spa. The resort is also home to the 16,800-seat Grand Garden Arena, where it hosts world-class concerts and headliners. There are numerous bars and lounges, including Studio 54 and the ultralounge -Tabu. The entertainment continues with KA by Cirque du Soleil-an unprecedented theatrical event. A masterpiece in storytelling, KA uses acrobatic performances, the thrills and action of martial arts techniques from all over the world, plus innovations in puppetry and multimedia to tell the epic tale of twins on a perilous journey to fulfill their shared destiny. Two elegantly appointed wedding chapels are on the property. Diverse shopping can be found along the Studio Walk or in the lower level of the main lobby in the Star Lane Shops. The Monorail station at MGM Grand provides easy access to other Las Vegas Strip hotels.
The hotel is centrally located on the Las Vegas Strip, only 3 miles from McCarran International Airport and 4 miles from Las Vegas Convention Center.

The elegant rooms are very large and decorated in classic motifs. Each room is accessorized with a custom black-and-white marble bathroom, luxurious cotton towels and spacious closets. All rooms are equipped with ironing board, hair dryer, in-room safe, remote control television, and alarm clock.

This mega-hotel is clad in emerald-green glass. It consists of four 30-storey towers, and is guarded by a 100,000-pound, 45-foot-tall bronze lion at the front entrance. It is set on 115 acres of lush grounds that feature a 6.6-acre coconut-grove garden with five pools, world-class spas, and a quarter-mile river.

The hotel offers endless dining options, from casual to elegant, from all-you-can-eat buffets to specialty restaurants. L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon is the culinary workshop of the gourmet mastermind. Featuring unique counter service where your dinner is prepared right before your eyes. Enjoy tapas, a tasting menu, and wines from around the world in a friendly and interactive atmosphere.Diego restaurant offers traditional recipes hand-picked from the Mexican countryside create the foundation for Diego's bold menu. Using honest ingredients and modern techniques, Diego presents authentic Mexican dishes with new twists. Emeril's restaurant offers a menu of market fresh fish, shellfish, steaks and his "New" New Orleans twist on Louisiana's Creole cooking. One of the most requested spots is at the restaurant's Seafood Bar, where guests can watch a variety of oysters and shellfish being shucked and prepared. Pear restaurant -serving traditional Chinese cuisine with an essence of the Canton and Shanghai provinces, Pearl's specialties are prepared using the four Chinese cooking methods: steamed, braised, baked, and fried.
The vast marble lobby is adjacent to the immense casino.
